website_summaries.verdict: This model extends to reach the highest limbs on most household property trees, and the 6.5 amp motor is powerful enough for the most common household cutting tasks.
pros: The telescoping pole extends to 8.7 feet, allowing users to make cuts on low-hanging limbs or trees of moderate height without a ladder
The 6.5 amp motor can handle limbs as thick as 7 inches, a surprising amount of power for this lightweight, maneuverable model
Corded power and auto-oiling technology means never having to stop a job to oil the chain or refuel
cons: Designed for occasional household use, this unit may wear out quickly if used more frequently or on larger jobs

website_summaries.verdict: An electric pole saw with unique features like automatic chain lubrication for a quick, convenient tree-pruning experience.
pros: Extends up to 8.7 feet and can cut branches up to 7.5-inches thick
Built-in safety switch prevents accidental starting
Sturdy yet lightweight pole that won't bend or come unscrewed
Cord lock feature keeps it from coming unplugged
cons: There have been a few reports of the oil reservoir leaking

website_summaries.verdict: If you need to tackle small to moderate trimming and pruning jobs, you'll be impressed with this model, but it's not the strongest contender for thick branches.
pros: Telescoping pole extends easily to reach branches up to 15 ft. overhead
cons: You're limited to the length of the cord
Not as rugged as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 time it worked great. Now i used this Wed morning 29, Aug, 2018. And half way though cutting, it stop working. So i thought maybe it over heated and got hot. I let it cool off until the evening about 7 hours. It worked for about a min or so and stopped again. I just tried it again this morning and it is dead as door nail. Waht a POS !!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the short time it worked - then the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the short time it worked - then the teeth on the main ring gear stripped out. Other than basic consumables parts are not available. So into the trash it went. This thing was cheap enough that I wasn't really surprised that it failed...but given the gentle use it saw I expected to get a bit more life out of it. Lesson learned - next saw will be a Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kenney

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Pro 1/Simple to assemble 2/easy to use 3/The extension bar is oval, it made the blade angle control so convenient 4/long bar 5/relatively light 6/coming with tool Con It should have "sit position" which oil will not leak. It always rolls to the side to rest.
customer_reviews.author: L. Su

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but after only a week of use, it stopped working. Called the company, but they wouldn't replace it because I hadn't registered the product through their website. Whoops. I guess that's partially on me, but, I feel like my Amazon purchase history should be sufficient proof if purchase. I really did like it at first, but I wouldn't order again because I don't want to deal with this again.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel Reisenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a bust.
customer_reviews.text: After second use it’s done. A use for me was one season using for less than an hour trimming on small tree in yard. Apparently the oil tank line came off and when I hung it back up the oil leaked down into the motor and down the handle. I opened it up to diagnose and found the loose oil line. The inside was coated (not what you want on electric motor). Of course it was also put together with the brushes unsecured and on opposite side of motor so when you take it apart to try to clean it’s a pain to put back together. It wasn’t worth the hassle and I trashed the entire mess.
customer_reviews.author: boomassiv

customer_reviews.title: Melted in 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: No stars should be given for this horrible product. My husband just used it for less than 15 mins (breaking after every cut of a 4 inch tree branch) and the stupid piece of crap already melted. It's dead. He followed all instructions, including using a short extension cord and oiling the chain. Do NOT buy this saw.
customer_reviews.author: jessica a.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. I used the saw three times before throwing ...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I used the saw three times before throwing it away. The chain kept coming off and eventually would not go back on properly. I was cutting small dead branches with the thing. If you think $60 is too cheap for a chain saw, you're right. Buy a real saw.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Branan

customer_reviews.title: Get the manual saw
customer_reviews.text: This product does not cut limbs quickly and holding my arm for a branch that's not even a 1/2 an inch for 5-6 minutes isn't even adequate, it sholudn't take that long. I utilized a manual one that only took me a minute or two.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Missing sprocket from inside the head where chain attaches
customer_reviews.text: Sprocket was missing inside the head where the chain is suppose to attach. Returning the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you need a pole saw, this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this Pole Chain now for about 2 hours of trimming trees. It works great, seems very durable, and does everything I've expected very well. I selected this item based primarily on the positive reviews on it, plus it's weight was a little less than some others. Believe me, for a old f*** like me, having even 1 pound less weight on the end of the 10' or 12' extended pole is significant! The only negative I can come up with is that it actually delivered 5 days later than it was originally scheduled - but I can deal with that for a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Livin' in AR

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great 3-6 inch branches
customer_reviews.text: cut great 2-6 inch branches ran well (still runs well), but after the 4th branch the pole cracked and bent in half. It can still be used just fine when not extended, but can no longer extend. Hoping to se if they will replace the pole. Note to users it is heavy at the end and takes patience to cut through the larger branches. Nevertheless a great product just a defective pole. Update: The company replaced the entire saw and shipped it out quickly! New saw works great!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay saw. I have giant trees on my property here in TX, and this is fine for cutting small branches, but try to cut anything with size like a 2-4" limb and you will find problems. The saw jumps and it takes a very long time to try to cut through it. I usually end up cutting it to a point and then snap/pull the branch down. This is a great saw for cutting small branches and light trimming but not powerful enough for any real trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Edward O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: It was the perfect thing I needed to trim up my trees
customer_reviews.text: I am a female 5'1", approx 100 pounds and was terrified to use this when it finally arrived in the mail. Assembly was simple. The size of this was a bit daunting at first. However,after getting help on how to start it with a neighbor, I couldn't stop using it! It operates with ease!. It is a bit heavy and when I was trimming a tree my shoulders got tired from balancing its weight with high branches. However, I don't regret buying it. It was the perfect thing I needed to trim up my trees.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley2743

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! I am a single woman homeowner and got sick and tired of asking friends to come Over to help me use a chain saw to trim branches. I had a manual pole saw that was the biggest pain in the neck (literally and figuratively) so I hated to use it. This tool is a dream! It's not too heavy for me and it extends quite a bit so I don't have to go so high on the ladder to cut hanging branches. I have no idea why I didn't buy one sooner. One of my best tool purchases, seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Staci S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take down an errant evergreen branch that was headed for our pool about 15 feet up. It has already paid for itself as my landscaper didn't want to try to cut it down and referred me to a tree guy. I wouldn't want to continuously use the pole saw at full extension, but it did work for what I needed and then some. I've already pruned other tree branches with it and I can now reach areas I couldn't get to with a ladder and hedge trimmers or a pruner. When a gas chain saw out of reach or just too much for the job but pruning shears won't cut it, this is a perfect alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Brickner

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have trimmed up many trees, some had branches 8 inches or more. So far it has worked remarkably well. I did not need to adjust the chain and it did keep oil on it. I just rested it on the limbs without putting any pressure on it and let it cut, just like on the video. I found that it has enough power to cut through the limbs like warm butter. It's a great value and I highly recommend this product. It sure is allot safer than getting up on a ladder to trim with a chainsaw and allot cheaper than an emergency trip to the hospital. I should have purchased this product years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is everything the previous reviewer said. He wrote a long and detailed review and because of the assets he shared I bought this. I am a 74 year young woman who lives with horses, chickens, etc. and does her own work of all kinds. This chainsaw is great. I also have 2 Stihl gas chainsaws, but don't want to do handle the heavy stuff anymore. Like the way this one telescopes with a mild spring action and an easy to use screw down method to hold it in place. Was easy to put together. Be sure to wear all safety gear no matter which one you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Good

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing for the price. Great product and value.
customer_reviews.text: This $50 telescoping electric chainsaw is absolutely amazing. It completely exceeded, and continues to exceed, my expectations about its quality and capability for the price, every time I use it. Highly recommended. Purchase with confidence. Be advised, I suggest picking up a quart of oil for it with your purchase, as I did myself, and top off its reservoir after each use. Friends of mine, who have now gone through a few of this type, have all advised me to completely avoid running these dry. Doing so will almost certainly cause irreparable damage, quickly, eventually causing a full seize, abruptly, if used without proper lubrication.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Great Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made on Amazon. I just happened to be looking on Amazon and this pole saw was on the deal of the day list for $49.99 with free shipping and it is worth every penny. The saw will cut through 6" limbs like they are butter. It is easy to handle, the extension is perfect and the blade is very sharp. I was able to trim my oak tree in about one hour. My landscaper charges $200.00 to trim the tree and haul off the limbs so I am already $150.00 ahead of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is defective, the chain comes off no matter how tight, the lock is not working to extend the saw
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS THING NOW!!! HIT THE BUTTON NOW!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!!! Very easy to use!! Very sharp and cuts very quickly and easily. I was cutting a limb and I didn’t realize I was standing on the same limb. I cut through it, I fell WITH the pole saw, landed on my car, cutting it in half, then fell to the ground and cut my dog in half!! I was really wishing my ex wife was around during this whole saw experience, but unfortunately she is still safe and sound. Crap!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Not a long lived item
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of value in this saw but the construction is not up to long service. In particular there is no internal frame for the motor and gear box meaning the alignment for the helical gears that drives the saw blade are dependent on the molded plastic case. These gears require precise spacing to work properly and when things move around the pinion gear jumped out out of alignment and chewed up the circular gear rendering the saw inoperable. Just a poor design. The saw may be okay for a few uses but not for anything beyond that........but then again it's inexpensive so you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Corona

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, works great but you need to be taller to hit 15 feet
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time yesterday...easy peasey setup and took down the branches in no time. I'm giving this four stars because the statement "Telescoping pole extends to 8.7 ft to provide 15 ft of overhead reach" is misleading. The instructions that came with the unit strongly recommends that pistol grip is held just above your waist; if your waist was six feet off the ground, then you could reach the 15 foot mark at full extension. Even so, the unit isn't horribly heavy so I was able hold it over my head (I'm just short of six feet) to get the job done. Again: easy setup, works great but you need to be taller to hit 15 feet.
customer_reviews.author: mkegaffer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible assembly - who thinks this up?
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous assemble - tightening the screw at an angle? Who thinks of this stuff? I had to go to the youtube video - even they have a tough time angling the screwdriver to tighten the chain. Oh - and after your done making sure you dont lose a finger - guess what - no chain oil! Hmm! you would think they could put a starter bottle of it inside... Gotta be an easier way to put on a chain
customer_reviews.author: TM44

customer_reviews.title: good overall
customer_reviews.text: First of all I liked it. It cut thick branches quite easily I did not rate it 5 stars for the following annoyances: 1- the power switch is located on the far end of the handle and not easily reachable 2- the pole is not totally collapsible rendering it unusable for cutting branches closer to you. 3- the lack of of ground make easier for power cord to become loose. Yes I did part the prong on the extension cord further apart to alleviate the problem. This said I still would recommend it giving it does the job at a low price
customer_reviews.author: lanhobby

customer_reviews.title: Best pole saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I worked this saw all day, I had to tighten the chain a few times but it wasn't to bad, the only downside is when the pole is fully extended there is a slight wobble or unsteady feeling to it, so I dropped it down a few inches and that helped, I would def. spend the money on this saw again, don't forget the bar and chain oil mine did not come with it. I'll add to my review after I get some more use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Saw!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome saw. I love that it has some weight to it but it's easy for a small woman to manage. It's not too loud. Easy to put together and oil. You will need to buy some chain saw oil. Easy to start. Worked like a dream. And was fun to use. I highly recommend this chain saw for those hard to reach places. It easily sawed through pretty thick limbs. I used it on limbs up to 8 or 9 inches across. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: Private Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where is my replacement?
customer_reviews.text: It broke after a few use in spring time March 2020. (short, inside wires bad connection? And chain was fully secured and then constantly pops off the track...etc.) , ever since being back and forth contacting customer service and promised a replacement, sent back the broken tool, DHL confirmed it was delivered on June 2nd, then contacted the customer service 3 times (2 emails + 1 live chat), today is July 3rd, if not going to send me a replacement, please send me back the broke one so I can get it fixed. I own few tools from Sun Joe, they offer great value and affordable options, but not after this terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Janice CK Tung

customer_reviews.title: but works great for the average homeowner who has basic mechanical aptitude
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased as a gift for my father in law, to keep him from climbing ladders with a chainsaw, and it did the trick. Requires a delicate touch to keep the chain sharp, and the chain tension correct, but works great for the average homeowner who has basic mechanical aptitude. Works even better if you have a friend that can touch up the chain with a file.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Only 8.7 feet long 15 foot reach is a lie.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this it is only 8.7 long fully extended the way the ad states is there is a 15 foot reach and the pole itself extends to 8.7. Dont understand where the 15 foot reach comes from. This was the only reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dartswinger73

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and safer than other methods.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like butter. Wish I had bought the one that disconnects from pole to use as hand held chain saw. The oil reservoir is small capacity so check your oil level every 15 minutes of use. I really love the leash that holds the oil cap on while you are filling it...nice touch. Way faster and safer than standing on a ladder and using a saws-all ( which you should never do). I couldn't be happier. If you order one make sure you order the SunJoe Chain saw oil... you won't find it cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! I used it to cut up the branches ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I used it to cut up the branches from an enormous tree that we're taking down and was able to do them all in just a couple of hours. Some tips: make sure you have a really small funnel for filling the oil and pour slowly because the hole is tiny. The second is that in the pictures for putting the chain on it's hard to see which way the teeth point so pay attention to the inner teeth and not the outer in the images. Also, make sure you read the manual about pinching. Overall this is a great little tool and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice buying, assembling, and using experience
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time promised, item was as described, no need for contact, easy to assemble and I'm a smaller lady. No problems with registering or warranty (3 yrs is about $12.00 -- may be cheaper through Amazon/AllState but you know the mfg. knows what is up with the machine. Might be you get what you paid for. I have ordered, received, and purchased a warranty for other tools through Asurion and I do not know which policy goes to what, as the listing says it (not what) is insured. Good luck with that when one of them stops working.
customer_reviews.author: cinnabar777

customer_reviews.title: Strongly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts wood like it is butter. I put it to use after Hurricane Matthew came through and it rose to the occasion. Keep an eye on the oil reservoir to ensure it doesn't run out and you will be good to go. Also check the chain tension after each use, just like with any chain saw. UPDATE: There was a 4" tear in the foam rubber hand grip. I contacted Sun Joe and asked for a replacement grip, but they are sending me a new saw. Awesome customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Molon Labe 5.56

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!  It reached into the base of overgrown pickerly holly bushes.
customer_reviews.text: I have a traditional chainsaw, but for safety I don't use when home alone. This allows me to keep the blade at a safe distance. It reached into the base of of overgrown shrubbery. I had seven overgrown holly bushes around the HVAC of the house I recently bought. Was not familiar with this brand, but pleasantly surprised. Easy to assemble as well as tightening the chain.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked amazingly well trimming branches up to several inches in diameter. It cuts very quickly. Seems durable. Althogh I do not think the automatic chain oiler is working - just oil manually occasionally. It can feel heavy when fully extended and held out at an angle. Also, one must be careful about where the branch may fall - they often come directly at you.
customer_reviews.author: J Brown

customer_reviews.title: Dont let it pinch
customer_reviews.text: I have run a chain saw for over 25 years and never had to replace a chain due a pinch which is when the chain and bar are closed up in the cut. Used this pole saw for about 45 mins and on the last cut the chain got caught in the cut and bent one of the links and now its not usable. Wrote the company and explained what had happened and never heard a word back. I have about 5 Sunjoe products and this will be my last. If the company doesn't bother to reply to a customers request its time go spend my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shipper

customer_reviews.title: W O R K S .....probably my favorite yard  tool purchase in the last 10 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw ...plug it in and go ! I have struggled with gas chainsaws for yrs and took a chance on this corded one . L O V E it . The handle extends perfectly and beyond what you would normally need . Its not super heavy. CUTS like butter . It will make short work of anything reasonable in width . I have cut up to 6 " oak branches with ZERO diificulty. How long it lasts remains to be seen but in the 4 times I have used it so far it has been awesome...will update as I get more hrs on it .
customer_reviews.author: JOHN F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of equipment for such a low price. I have a chainsaw, but I had some limbs that needed to come down. Not wanting to see myself on an episode of Trauma Life in the ER, I opted to buy this instead of climbing a ladder and running a chainsaw with one hand while holding on with the other. It was easy to assemble and very easy to use. It went through the limbs with ease. Just an FYI for anyone looking at one of these, you will need bar oil. I would definitely buy this again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This saw made quick work of some 5 inch limbs. The only issue that I had was the cord has a shield around the plug that limits the type of extension cord end you can use. Also it's fairly easy to pull the plug out, which is frustrating if you get to the top of a ladder and the extension cord comes unplugged. I ended up taping the cords together with duct tape. The extension tubes and motor assembly are fairly heavy so you have to be careful to control the saw when it cuts through.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Will it last?
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome little saw,goes together in a few minutes,gets job done.First off I went for a 30ft.,7'',branch overhanging my rear deck,Starting at the end ,cut it back piece by piece,until it curved up too high to reach.So,took it off at the tree,7-8",came right down with a crash.Sectioned it up, hauled it away.Probably more than the saw was designed for,but did the job.As a 78 year old,at full reach you have to cut down,bit to heavy for up cuts.All in all a real deal.
customer_reviews.author: kwsailor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Never heard of Sun Joe, but this thing is really good for the price. Super easy setup, took maybe 10 min tops. Just slip on chain, add oil. Mostly plastic, but very sturdy feel. Trimmed several good sized oak trees on my property. Sliced through 2-4" branches like nuthin. Run time, about 30 min total, adjusted chain once, but didnt really have to. At this price point, its already paid for itself, and barely used. Great value for your home DIY'er. I'm a new Sun Joe fan.
customer_reviews.author: hansolo

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife through butter (if bushed were butter)
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing a lot. It's a beast. It seems to cut anything and pulls a lot of power from the 110v outlet. I accidentally knocked the chain off a few times by moving it at an angle while going through thick tree but it was so easy to put back on I didn't even mind when it happened (again my fault ). I'd suggest getting a strap so when it pulls you forward after you've cut something above you at 8 feet you're not trying to control the weight of the saw on the end of a pole falling and you won't sprain your shoulder or pull any muscles out like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roy

customer_reviews.title: Decent long pole saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it is. I actually wish you could make it a little shorter for easier handling sometimes. But this is not what it’s was made for, so I can’t really knock points off for this. Decent quality. Cuts reasonably well though it’s hard to control as the pole flexes quite a lot when extended fully. Doesn’t like to cut branches of less than 3/4” and tends to chew them up rather than leaving a nice clean cut. Does not come with any chain oil, which is absolutely needed to use it. They even stress this several times in their instructions and a tiny bottle would have made it so I could at least try it out on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murten

customer_reviews.title: Actually fun to trim now!
customer_reviews.text: Every year I dread trimming the two trees in my back yard! Climbing up on a ladder with a hand saw, teetering back and forth.....can't raise my arms for three days afterward.... Then I thought, "How can amazon help?" And there it was---category, "pole chain saw"! Read all the reviews, and decided on an electric one---the Sun Joe SWJ800E seemed to foot the bill for me. Turned out to be an excellent choice! Easy and fun to assemble (don't forget the "chain saw bar & chain oil"). Trimming was finished in under an hour...not HOURS! No ladder-teetering. No sore arms! The $70 price was well-earned in the first use of this great implement. Can't wait for next year!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so worth the money. It is actually amazing how awesome it works. It was well worth the risk of buying. It doesn't cut huge logs, but I cut branches that were at MAX 6 inches around and it took a second, but if you cut it correctly, they come right down. This thing is powerful. Just make sure you keep checking the oil. Also buy oil.. it does not come with it. It is such a good product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J.L. Ko

customer_reviews.title: Great, only issue is oil leaks out.
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily to trim the 4 palm trees in our backyard. I have used this so far on 3 occasions, and I love how quick and easy it cuts down the palm tree leaves. I have also used it to cut down other thick bushes and branches from other trees with no problems. The only issue I have with it is that the chain oil will leak out no matter how tight the cap is screwed on.
customer_reviews.author: _.EfraiN._

customer_reviews.title: Ok tool for price, has flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Ok saw for the price. Has worked well so far, having spent 3 off days trimming maple and sycamore limbs on my property (max 6” Diameter). Only issues so far have been with the tension mentioned by others. I find myself having to adjust it manually a few times per use. I feel that this issue will be the demise of this tool as the chain loosens and tries to eat itself. I have been able to catch it without issue to this point, but might not get so lucky in the future usages.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This Pole Chain saw is absolutely wonderful. It saved me so much time rather than using a tree saw. The chain blade is so sharp, it cut right through my Maple tree branches without any problem or hesitation (some were very large limbs). Cant say enough about his unit. Would definitely buy, and recommend, again. The only negative is that the chain saw end is heavy and when the unit is extended, using it horizontal (not pointed up), it does weigh on your arms.
customer_reviews.author: David 204

customer_reviews.title: So easy a 40yr old woman can use it
customer_reviews.text: I am a 40 year old woman and just love this thing! Its so easy to use and normal chain saws make me nervous (I've never used one) but I use this all the time to trim my trees and chop up down tree branches. Only downfall is it does get heavy when extended so I can't use it very long without giving my arms a break. Follow the instructions and make sure the blade is touching the tree when you start it to avoid blowback. Highly recommended and a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Michele S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the pice. Sturdy but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice trimmer for the price. It feels very sturdy but heavy. It came pre-assembled but still need to install the blade which took me few minutes to figure out. Right off the bat, I learned you need a lot of strength to use this fully extended at an angle. It would have helped to have a grab handle on the pole. A body harness will help in this situation. I am a left handed person so I tend to control things with my left hand. This is designed for a right handed person. They could have built a trigger type switch rather than a button. Nevertheless, this is a small powerful trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Mhetz

customer_reviews.title: Cuts branches like butter, long handle.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well and quickly this cuts through branches. I have a powerful Stihl MS310 gas chainsaw but big jobs but I couldn't believe how well this small electric one cuts with no gas motor to deal with. You will laugh when you see how big they may the blade look on the box, it is small but cuts amazingly well. The twist lock to hold the pole when extended could be better made but all in all it is a great machine at a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, best 53 dollars I have spent in a long, long time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to trim up this maple before taken down and this thing is wonderful and the blade is so sharp. The best thing is once the tree was on the ground using it to cut all the smaller branches instead of bending over with regular chainsaw. It was so much easier on the back and not tripping over branches with a running chain saw in hand and it cuts great. Got it with special 20 bucks off but still well worth it without discount. GREAT SAW!!!
customer_reviews.author: cudaguy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming on a ranch in Oregon
customer_reviews.text: For $62 this has worked out quite well. I live on a ranch in NE Oregon, remote from assistance. I have to be able to do most anything. This has helped me to prune several very large trees although I did some of them with an extension ladder propped against my tractor loader and me with my arms out and the cutter all the way out. And it worked. Very good cutting head. It does get a little cutting oil leaking around the motor head, but this is to be expected when using upside down. The only problem I can see is that the tightening knurl for adjusting the length seems to be getting a little worn.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and Handles Well
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works better than I expected, especially for the price. I trimmed a number of my trees one recent afternoon and was very happy with the performance of this machine. It is not awkward to handle, the telescoping body of the trimmer locks into place as it should without a lot of effort and it cut every limb I could reach. My only suggestion would be to make the chain oil fill opening larger. I still rated a five because it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: It works great! But doesn't come with/ oil😖
customer_reviews.text: This works really well once you get some oil. At first I was turned off, because I asked over and over in the question section, does it come with the oil it needs. They all replied it does come with a small bottle. Guess what. NO oil! So I have the saw all ready to fire up and no oil! But after I got the oil, it worked great, slicing through whatever I tasked it with. The blade is very small, but it works! And having the reach is such a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: THATZLIFE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: 10 minutes out of the box and it was ready to go. Nothing complicated if you've ever used a chainsaw before. The grip & switches are ergonomic, the pole and extender locking collar are robust and easy to operate. It's lightweight but has plenty of power. The complaints about it leaking bar chain oil while in storage are overblown...All my chainsaws do that. If you store this one with the bar screw facing up, it will only leak a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: As good as can be expected, for an electric chainsaw that cost under $100. The box it came in was mostly crushed and a bit ripped. The padded hand grip ripped and peeled back after the first hour of use; no biggie though, wearing gloves help that. Blade needs to be sharpened after every few trees trimmed; mostly cutting limbs under 1” in diameter. Overall, it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: I'm a cut up now!
customer_reviews.text: Too bad there isn't 6 stars. Received this today. Excellent packaging. Arrived right on time. Assembled in a couple of minutes (all one needs to do is attach the bar with the chain and add some bar/chain oil. Took if to my backyard... WOW. Cut through limbs like they were butter! Never a problem, no kick back, chain is apparently exceptionally sharp! Plenty of power. Great reach! I would guess that I'm money ahead over having a professional tree trimming company come over and trim these trees! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Judge

customer_reviews.title: Ehh...
customer_reviews.text: I don't how this thing got good reviews. It is hard on my arms does not cut limbs thicker than 3 inches wide without a lot of pressure. I wonder if something is wrong with mine? Could I have gotten a lemon?
customer_reviews.author: SKK

customer_reviews.title: Tips for successful use
customer_reviews.text: Dynamite pole chain saw! Made fast work of droopy backyard tree limbs. Saved me big money on a pro tree trimmer! Assemble the chain in the RIGHT DIRECTION (it can be reversed). Check and adjust the chain slack - it stretches especially with first use. Trim big branches in short pieces to keep the saw from being caught in a bind (12 feet in the air like I did). Be sure to keep the oil topped off. Huge value!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Store on side
customer_reviews.text: Works well I got to cut down some hedges that were overgrown.... Cheaper than hiring somebody to do it. It is rather long on pole and you cant collapse pole so it takes some room to lie flat.... top heavy to stand up and dont want to turn other way and rest on chain all time even with plastic guard...I stored alongside the wall of garage as i has access...Electric is nice and I got some bar chain oil at HD ..... for what i needed it for and cost I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tiare Dreams

customer_reviews.title: The warranty service department came thru for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2015, used it to trim some pine limbs, started whining just as i finished, didnt use it again until this year, 2017, the whining got worse, tried adjusted the chain tightness, persisted, the gears between the motor and chain ratchet are stripped, cheap junk, probably cut a total of 30 limbs, DO NOT BUY I contacted their customer service department, they assured me they would send a new saw, even though it was 2 years since I bought the old one. So I changed my rating on this item to 4 stars to reflect the quality of their customer service, and that perhaps this saw as just a lemon in their production line
customer_reviews.author: W B moore

customer_reviews.title: Fast and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this item. I cleared 2 hours worth of dead limbs that have been nagging me for years. No issues, the self oiling works great. Carry the chain adjustment too with you, not a big deal but within 2 hours i tightened the chain 5 times. Works great and fast. Although one of the lightest poor chain saws I would not recommend this for a small women. One you extend the pole to the 8' length and extend out to a branch it can be difficult to regain control after the branch is cut.
customer_reviews.author: gstam

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This thing does the work. Got it for a lesser price here (thanks Amazon!) and I admit, I was a little skeptical because it's electric and rather small looking... But it really does the job great. Cuts through thick branches and reaches very high as advertised. This was used to cut branches which were hanging over the house roof. For the insurance company to be happy, the branches had to go and the Sun Joe did the job, made it easy. Recommended? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would buy
customer_reviews.text: This little toy is legit. It made dealing with my pine trees a breeze. One problem I had is that the chain tension screw managed to work itself loose and fell out sometime during using it, no idea where it went. Luckily I already had a similar replacement bolt and this one hasn't worked loose so far. Great product, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A Product That Was Advertised As Is
customer_reviews.text: This product was used to trim the branches of an injured tree caused by a severe storm. After performing the appropriate adjustments, the unit performed flawlessly. It's self lubrication system kept the chain clean and sharp. Several limbs were removed and later cut into small sections so they could be set out at the curb. When using this product for it's intended purpose it continued to operate with no problems. In short, I would recommend this product to anyone that needs a tool to efficiently remove unwanted tree branches.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cut through the limbs like butter! Went through oil quickly so keep an ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'5', 48 year old women in decent shape and was able to lift this chainsaw at full length and get my job done! Cut through the limbs like butter! Went through oil quickly so keep an eye on that. It may appear flimsy but any heavier and I would not be able to lift it comfortably. Nice product Sun Joe!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Realtor/Broker

customer_reviews.title: Great for moderate tree trimming
customer_reviews.text: this saw is probably one of the best yard tools I’ve bought, especially for that price. So far, it has saved me about 1k worth of work, compared to hiring a contractor to do the same job. Easy to use, great reach and with the right extension cord you can get anywhere in the yard. A bit too heavy so may need a couple breaks or your arms get tired from holding it. I trimmed a whole bunch of overgrown honeysuckles, some maples with lower branches and a shade tree above my pond. It is actually capable of cutting branches that 6-8 inches thick, just takes a little longer and you have reangle the cut a couple times. Great saw!
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: this is a tool every house owner should have for going after branches or getting at hard to reach unwanted brush on your property long pole handle easily extends longer to reach higher branches it will prune a thin branch or cut thru a 5 inch tree limb strong and powerful as with any powered cutting tool wear eye protection this chain saw cuts and cuts fast its made to fit into tight spots and always monitor chain oil reservoir its an auto feed so its pushing oil onto the chain at all times
customer_reviews.author: LMR

customer_reviews.title: This saw is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sketchy at first, but after using it, this thing is great. If you keep it filled with oil, and the chain tensioned, you will have no problems. I used it on a big job cutting through a big branch on the side of my Magnolia Tree, and then cut it into sections. I did have to add oil, and tension the chain halfway through, but that is a breeze. Got a quart of Chainsaw oil at HD, and use a big flat head screwdriver on the tension screw. Like any good tool, you need to keep it maintained for long life.
customer_reviews.author: TrainTec

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive since it is an electric chainsaw, but hot damn does this saw cut through everything!!! 10/10 product, super amazing! As a side note, you feel like Guan-yu swinging around his Green Dragon Crescent Blade (guandao), so you feel pretty badass using the tool itself. BUT, one MAJOR CON, the opening for the chain oil.. is far too small, I tried using a funnel and ended up with chain oil all over my backyard.. besides that one small flaw, this saw is freaking amazinG!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for coconut palms
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is great for removing palm fronds and opening coconuts. It seems sturdily built and well assembled. The pole extends and locks easily. The motor has plenty of power. It cuts fast and smooth. On the downside, it needs quite a long cord too reach around the yard. I am regretting not spending the extra dough to get a cordless unit that converts to a hand saw too.
customer_reviews.author: jazm44

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter!!!
customer_reviews.text: My poor Walter ( yes, we name our trees) had a few dead branches. With the help of the Sun Joe pole saw, he is looking much better. Sadly, I do believe Walter may be seeing his last winter coming up. Please note, that when storing the pole saw with chain oil already added, it must be layed horizontally....or the oil will leak out down the pole. Learned that the hard way! Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, simple, easy to maneuver. Definitely recommend for quick pruning.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised how well this pole chainsaw works. My husband cut the branches of the tree out front that was digging into the facade of our home in no time. It's very simple to use, lightweight, and easy to maneuver while on a ladder. We will be pruning our peach tree with this. We purchased the cheapest chainsaw bar and chain oil and lubricated before use. You definitely need a long outdoor extension cord as there's barely any length on this cord.
customer_reviews.author: Sven5000

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a floppy manual trimmer, I bought this and never looked back! Keep the chain properly adjusted. Keep the oil filled. Don't pretend it's a full-size chain saw. I used this to make fast work of what was a hard job. And $65 bucks? Worth every penny and more. I also grab this (handle as short as it will go) and cut up branches for use in my firepit. I effectively cut branches 6 and 7 inches in diameter. Yep. Really appreciate having this inexpensive tool around when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott shriver

customer_reviews.title: Broke within the first month
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw was great, the first 3 times it was used, then it just stopped working while cutting a small branch. I have had it for less than a month and used it a handful of times. I am very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: P. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Nice branch trimming around the yard.
customer_reviews.text: We used this yesterday to clear branches beginning to touch the roof. This simply becomes a racetrack for squirrels and not good for the roof. It’s a bit heavy not fully extended. We’re worried that we will not be able to use it extended but we shall see. It did a wonderful job on 2-4” branches zipping right on through. Pleased with the performance and results. We will likely get used to the weight of the saw. I would recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This saw has saved me hundreds just for my palm trees. It works well and if you take your time, it makes short work of any and all bushes and trees. Do not listen to the negative reviews because half of them complain about it not including chain oil. Just buy the chain oil locally or as an add on item and you are good to go. I opted for the corded option because I never have to worry about batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for roughly a week and have used it twice. It works great so far. I was looking for a good deal on a pole saw and this was definitely a good deal. It assembled easily and cuts well. It is decently heavy when extended to it's full length and held above one's head. I don't think it could be avoided and all pole saws would likely have that problem. I managed fine. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best tools I have ever used. It's practical, not heavy, runs great, has power to do the job. The only recommendation is that you be sure to have a sharp chain. It is an electric motor and a dull chain may cause it to over heat. Otherwise, it cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and did the job!
customer_reviews.text: So I had a bunch of smaller limbs I needed to trim on some trees and didn’t want to pay someone just for that if I could do it myself. Since I’d never used a saw I asked for help from a friend in assembling and usage. It did just what I wanted and I even cut down some smaller dead trees that I couldn’t saw through with a handsaw. I read the reviews about the oil leaking so I’ve stored it with the oil cap up.
customer_reviews.author: MKZ

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Even if you have a manual pole pruner, you still need this! The reach may not be quite as long, but the speed at which you can prune small or large branches is fantastic. I also use it on blackberry bushes. At first, I thought that having the weight of a motorized cutter at the top of a pole would be tiring to use, but it's not that heavy, and the reduced time that you have to hold it overhead vs. manual pruning more than makes up for it. The only negative is that after a couple of uses, the neoprene foam handle covering fell apart, but it is not very slippery to hold without it.
customer_reviews.author: T22

customer_reviews.title: works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed this until I got it, sure beets cutting branches with a Sawzall and ladder. I was a little worried about electric chain saw doing the job but have found out this has more power and easer to use than my gas chain saw
customer_reviews.author: bshrove

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 3 branches, then dulled out.
customer_reviews.text: The blade that comes with this thing is a joke, it cut through a few branches really well, then basically turned into trying to cut through a branch with a butter knife.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Good product...
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily to prune a small tree on my property. The largest branch would be around 3" and this product melts through them quickly. The build quality is good and works like traditional chain saws without the combustion motor. It's easy to maintain and all you have to do is fill the chain oil reservoir. The only problem is that smaller branches tend to get caught. This can be annoying. That being said, I would still recommend to have in your arsenal of landscaping tools with small to medium trees.
customer_reviews.author: ArnellTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Bent chain on first use. Requires Oil but my purchase sepy
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend. Cutting a branch about 3-4" and it bent the chain as the branch started collapsing. I don't give it a bunch of stars for Maneuverability as when its fully extended, the weight is all on the front in. When that's out at a 70-90 degree angle it makes it hard to use. ****update*** requires oil but comes empty.
customer_reviews.author: IamYourGod

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy!  (...but it's good.)
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pole-saw for 2 days now and man, it does everything it says it will. Other than being heavy, I see no drawbacks to this at all. I also had a sunjoe electric mower that had a problem and their customer service was a delight to work with. I hope it lasts 2 years but I've already gotten more than my money's worth out of it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if this would work very well. It does! Wish I had this years ago. Makes pruning so much easier. No more manual pole sawing or precarious chain saw trimming. Even used it to take down two hedges at their base that die back in the winter and return in the spring. Used to use both a power and manual hedge trimmer. Both options were a bear.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Farkash

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use, good power behind it
customer_reviews.text: Did an excellent job cutting down our low branches around our house. It didn't come with chain oil/lube so make sure you buy that if you're planning on using it right out of the box. Saved us a lot of money to cut the branches ourselves. Worked well. Easy to use. Lightweight but powerful. Got hung up on a couple larger branches but that may have been operator error. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Different Than Advertised...
customer_reviews.text: First, the product is very well made, and Support is excellent... However, I was quite disappointed it 'did not' have the 'Adjustable Angle' as shown on the Amazon advertisement page. (Click on the page link then scroll down to 'more detail' just below where it says, "From The Manufacturer") It shows a multi-angle cutting bar, not fixed. I believed I was buying the model with the 'adjustable angle' head or I would not have purchased this mode. I really have no use for a 'fixed head'. This is quite deceiving. (see copy of photo attached, from Amazon page) Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Rantasia

customer_reviews.title: Useful saw for cutting tree branches
customer_reviews.text: This is a corded pole chain saw for cutting lower branches of trees without the need of a ladder. Although the saw is heavy on a long pole, the saw can be rested on the branch while it is cutting. It is quite effective and will save your energy. You need to check the chain saw oil level before each use, as oil will leak during storage.
customer_reviews.author: Oyaji

customer_reviews.title: Sun-Joe Saw, it reached, and dropped it!!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this saw, to be honest got a bad one first, the poles extended too far out beyond stop and sent back, got replacement from Amazon quickly. Have used this now for few years and this thing just cuts everything! Just watch when weight from big limb can bind saw in cutting slot. Pull out and come from other side-bottom. Terrific cutting up after limbs down on ground too! Keep oil handy to refill Auto oiler for chain bar, but just works Great!!!
customer_reviews.author: DOB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit my expectations weren't set high because of the low price I paid for this chain saw. To my very pleasant surprise this product performed better that I ever expected. Absolutely no issues with this product. I've used it on mature oak trees and it works flawlessly. Would definitely buy it again. I would trust Sun Joe products after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 uses. Repair will be covered under warranty provide that I pay about half the cost of the item to send it back. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What a work horse. Get a second chain. Works great with a sharp chain. Well balanced. Never lugged down the motor cutting 4", to 10" oak tree limbs. The length of the handle allows you to back cut from the top of the saw with out kickback. No flipping the saw over to cut the bottom of the branch. Monitor the oil level closely, It flows quickly while cutting. When finished, roll it over and pour the oil back in a bottle. No mess on the floor. Use a 12 awg wire cord for voltage drop and amperage needs of the saw.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: A great 120v extendable Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim a few dead limbs from a tree. As luck would have it, another Limb fell the night before this arrived. Great timing. I used it a lot for the next few days. Only advise... Keep check on the chain Oil. It runs out quickly... or maybe I cut too many limbs. It really does do a good job. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rockett

customer_reviews.title: Certainly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this now for a couple of months. Does a great job on most sized limbs. Cuts through very easily. Goes through chain oil a little faster than other saws I've used. I wish there was a way to break this down a little for easier storage. But it has been running very strong and has handled most jobs I have used it for with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Paige C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!  A time and injury saver.
customer_reviews.text: It has made the annual trimming of my tree a breeze. I severely injured the tendons in my elbow using a traditional ratchet lopper. Not only does this trimmer cut quicker and smoother than the lopper, I can cut much thicker branches and higher branches with ease. I have 4 trees in my backyard, and it reduced what usually takes all morning to about 30 minutes. Assembly is fairly quick, just make sure to purchase chainsaw lubricant. Sturdy enough construction, especially for the price. Even if it broke after the first use, it still would have been worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba man

customer_reviews.title: Under-powered
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and setup. The problem is its power and cutting ability. I had a hard time cutting limbs on maple trees. It took multiple minutes to cut 3" branches. A bow saw or a small gas chainsaw would have ripped through it in under a minute. I was hoping I could find something that would keep me off a ladder or from hiring someone else. This isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Weiss

product_meta.title: Sun Joe SWJ800E 8-Inch 6.5-Amp Telescoping Electric Pole Chain Saw with Automatic Chain Lubrication System
product_meta.description: Tackle those hard-to-reach branches with ease. The Sun Joe Saw Joe SWJ800E pole chain saw takes the danger and difficulty out of trimming your overgrown trees. Stand safely on solid ground and simply adjust Saw Joe’s telescoping pole to gain up to 15 feet of overhead reach. Powered by a 6.5-amp motor, the SWJ800E can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 7.5-inches thick. This pole chain saw features an 8-inch Oregon bar and chain with an auto-oiler to keep the bar and chain fully lubricated during use. Unlike gas-powered tools, Saw Joe is powered electrically, so you’ll reliably power up with the push of a button without having to deal with smoke, fumes, unpredictable starters or costly tune-ups. Plus the SWJ800E comes equipped with a built-in safety switch to prevent accidental starting. Saw Joe is CSA approved and carries a full two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: EXTENDS REACH: Ideal for cutting overhanging limbs and thin logs
TELESCOPING: Pole extends to 8.7 ft. to provide 15 ft. of overhead reach. No Load Speed (rpm) 6000. Sound Power Level : 108 dB
POWERFUL: 6.5-amp motor cuts branches up to 7.5-inches thick
AUTO-LUBRICATION: 8-inch cutting bar and chain with automatic lubrication. Oil tank capacity (fluid ounce): 2.7

WE’VE GOT YOU COVERED!: Your new pole chainsaw is backed by the Snow Joe + Sun Joe Customer Promise. We will warrant new, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. NO QUESTIONS ASKED. Contact Snow Joe + Sun Joe customer support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,554 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
